Chiang: s office issued a press release stating that the savings to the general public, including taxpayers, from bond refunding amounted to approximately $5 billion since Chiang took office in January 2015.
Deputy Treasurer Tim Schaefer explained: 5 billion represents future savings from refinanced state debt, which will accumulate over decades as bonds are paid off at lower rates.
The treasurer: s office provided a chart showing the future savings, totaling $5.5 billion, based on actions taken through mid-April 2017.
